title: H01-1049

sentences.text: Listen-Communicate-Show -LRB- LCS -RRB- is a new paradigm for human interaction with data sources .
We integrate a spoken language understanding system with intelligent mobile agents that mediate between users and information sources .
We have built and will demonstrate an application of this approach called LCS-Marine .
Using LCS-Marine , tactical personnel can converse with their logistics system to place a supply or information request .
The request is passed to a mobile , intelligent agent for execution at the appropriate database .
Requestors can also instruct the system to notify them when the status of a request changes or when a request is complete .
We have demonstrated this capability in several field exercises with the Marines and are currently developing applications of this technology in new domains .

Entity-an_application_of_this_approach.label: an application of this approach
Entity-an_application_of_this_approach.description: LCS-Marine, a system that enables tactical personnel to converse with their logistics system to place supply or information requests and receive notifications on request status changes.

Entity-lcs-marine.label: LCS-Marine
Entity-lcs-marine.description: A software application that enables tactical personnel to converse with their logistics system using spoken language, allowing them to place supply or information requests and receive notifications on request status.

Entity-using_lcs-marine.label: Using LCS-Marine
Entity-using_lcs-marine.description: A method for tactical personnel to interactively communicate with their logistics systems using spoken language and intelligent mobile agents.

Entity-the_request.label: The request
Entity-the_request.description: A supply or information request placed by tactical personnel through their logistics system using LCS-Marine.

Entity-requestors.label: Requestors
Entity-requestors.description: Individuals who place supply or information requests through the LCS-Marine logistics system, and can also instruct the system to notify them of status updates.

Entity-to_place_a_supply_or_information_.label: to place a supply or information request
aliases: to place a supply or information request
Entity-to_place_a_supply_or_information_.description: The act of submitting a demand for supplies or data through the LCS-Marine system.

mentions.local_name: to place a supply or information request

Entity-listen-communicate-show.label: Listen-Communicate-Show
Entity-listen-communicate-show.description: A spoken language understanding system integrated with intelligent mobile agents that mediate between users and information sources.

Entity-new_domain.label: new domains
Entity-new_domain.description: New areas or fields where a technology, such as LCS- Marine, can be applied to improve human interaction with data sources.

Entity-lcs.label: LCS
Entity-lcs.description: A notation, approach, system, or abbreviation used in describing and facilitating human interaction with data sources.

Entity-we_(1).label: We
Entity-we_(1).description: The authors or developers of the Listen-Communicate-Show (LCS) paradigm, responsible for building and demonstrating its applications.

Entity-the_system.label: the system
Entity-the_system.description: A spoken language understanding system integrated with intelligent mobile agents, enabling users to converse and place requests for information or supplies.

Entity-their_logistics_system.label: their logistics system
Entity-their_logistics_system.description: A computerized system that enables tactical personnel to interactively submit requests for supplies or information and receive updates on the status of those requests.

Entity-we.label: We
Entity-we.description: The authors of the paper, who are developing an application called LCS- Marine.

Entity-we_(2).label: We
Entity-we_(2).description: The authors, developers of the Listen-Communicate-Show (LCS) paradigm

Entity-user_and_information_source.label: users and information sources
Entity-user_and_information_source.description: The entity referred to by 'users and information sources' represents the parties involved in human interaction, including individuals (tactical personnel) who request supplies or information from databases through spoken language understanding systems mediated by intelligent mobile agents.

Entity-this_capability.label: this capability
Entity-this_capability.description: The ability to demonstrate a spoken language understanding system integrated with intelligent mobile agents for mediating between users and information sources.

Entity-spoken_language_understanding_sys.label: spoken language understanding system
Entity-spoken_language_understanding_sys.description: A technology or system designed to comprehend and interpret spoken human languages.

Entity-logistics_system.label: logistics system
Entity-logistics_system.description: A systematic process for planning, coordinating, and controlling the movement of goods, supplies, and services from one place to another.

Entity-several_field_exercise_with_the_m.label: several field exercises with the Marines
aliases: several field exercises with the Marines
Entity-several_field_exercise_with_the_m.description: A series of military training activities conducted jointly by personnel from a logistics system and the United States Marine Corps.

Entity-a_mobile.description: An autonomous software entity that executes requests and provides notifications on behalf of users in an information system.

Entity-intelligent_mobile_agent.label: intelligent mobile agents
Entity-intelligent_mobile_agent.description: Software entities that are capable of autonomous movement and decision-making, designed to interact with various systems or environments.

Entity-user.label: users
Entity-user.description: Individuals who interact or utilize services, systems, or platforms.

aliases: a request changes or when a request is complete
Entity-a_request_change_or_when_a_reques.description: The event where the status of a user's supply or information request changes, either by being fulfilled or completed.

Entity-intelligent_agent.description: A software system that uses artificial intelligence to perform tasks autonomously.

Entity-field_exercise.description: Military training or testing activities conducted outdoors

summary: Listen-Communicate-Show -LRB- LCS -RRB- is a new paradigm for human interaction with data sources . We integrate a spoken language understanding system with intelligent mobile agents that mediate between users and information sources . We have built and will demonstrate an application of this approach called LCS-Marine . Using LCS-Marine , tactical personnel can converse with their logistics system to place a supply or information request . The request is passed to a mobile , intelligent agent for execution at the appropriate database . Requestors can also instruct the system to notify them when the status of a request changes or when a request is complete . We have demonstrated this capability in several field exercises with the Marines and are currently developing applications of this technology in new domains .

Predicate-integrate_with.label: integrate with
Predicate-integrate_with.description: To combine or unify two entities (or systems) to create a cohesive and functional whole. This predicate indicates that the subject entity has formed an association with another entity, allowing them to work together seamlessly.

Predicate-mediate_between.label: mediate between
Predicate-mediate_between.description: To mediate between two entities means to act as a neutral or impartial intermediary that facilitates communication, understanding, or resolution between them. This predicate implies a role of facilitation, negotiation, or arbitration, where the subject (mediator) bridges the gap between the object's constituent parts, enabling effective interaction and cooperation.

Predicate-have_built_and_will_demonstrat.label: have built and will demonstrate an application of
Predicate-have_built_and_will_demonstrat.description: This predicate indicates that the subject has created or developed something (the object), which they are also prepared to showcase its practical usage. The connection between the subject and object lies in the idea of creation, implementation, and demonstration, highlighting the subject's expertise and ability to apply their knowledge.

Predicate-is.label: is
Predicate-is.description: The predicate 'is' indicates a state or condition that holds between the subject and object. It establishes an equivalence relationship, stating that the subject is identical to or has the same properties as the object.

Predicate-converse_with.label: converse with
Predicate-converse_with.description: To converse with means to engage in a verbal exchange or dialogue with something, typically an entity that can respond or interact. This predicate connects the subject (the conversing party) and object (the thing being communicated with), indicating a mutual interaction where information is exchanged, ideas are shared, or instructions are given.

Predicate-can_converse_with_their_logist.label: can converse with their logistics system to place a supply or information request
Predicate-can_converse_with_their_logist.description: This predicate indicates that the subject has the ability and means to interactively communicate with an object (their logistics system), which enables them to submit requests for supplies or information. The connection between the subject and object lies in their capacity to engage in a dialogue, leveraging the capabilities of the logistics system to fulfill specific needs.

Predicate-passed_to.label: passed to
Predicate-passed_to.description: Indicates that something (the subject) was transferred or handed over to someone or something else (the object), often implying a sense of movement or transmission from one entity to another.

Predicate-for_execution_at.label: for execution at
Predicate-for_execution_at.description: The predicate 'for execution at' indicates a relationship between an entity (the subject) and a specific context or environment where some action or process related to that entity should take place. The object represents the location, platform, or system where this execution occurs.

Predicate-instruct.label: instruct
Predicate-instruct.description: To instruct means to convey information or guidance in a way that enables someone (or something) to perform an action, follow a procedure, or achieve a goal. The subject of the predicate 'instruct' has knowledge or expertise that they are sharing with the object, which may be another person, entity, or system.

Predicate-have_demonstrated.label: have demonstrated
Predicate-have_demonstrated.description: To 'have demonstrated' means to show or prove something through evidence, action, or performance. It indicates that the subject has successfully exhibited a quality, skill, or characteristic, making it observable and verifiable by others.

Predicate-demonstrated_in.label: demonstrated in
Predicate-demonstrated_in.description: The predicate 'demonstrated in' indicates a context or environment where an action (implied by the subject) was performed. It suggests that the subject's actions, skills, or abilities were showcased within the specified object, which can be a setting, situation, or activity.

Predicate-using.label: using
Predicate-using.description: The predicate 'using' indicates a relationship where the subject (an entity or concept) employs, utilizes, or makes use of something specified by the object. This connection implies that the subject derives benefit, advantage, or value from using the object.

Predicate-have_built.label: have built
Predicate-have_built.description: To indicate that a subject has created or constructed something (the object), often implying a sense of planning, designing, and bringing into existence.

Predicate-can_converse.label: can converse
Predicate-can_converse.description: The predicate 'can converse' indicates that the subject has the ability to engage in a conversation with someone or something represented by the object. This implies mutual understanding and exchange of information, ideas, or thoughts between the subject and the object.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject is a specific instance or example of a more general category or concept represented by the object. The relationship between the subject and object is one of instantiation, where the subject exemplifies or embodies the characteristics of the broader term.
